Reviews.Title: “the WORST hotel”
Reviews.Author: Angie326
Reviews.Content: I will NOT let my dog stay @ this hotel. We paid for this hotel and then we left.

Reviews.Title: “BEDBUGS!”
Reviews.Author: knozbetta
Reviews.Content: do not stay at this hotel. I was there only for one night and five days later I am covered, absolutely covered with bed bug bites! I had to throw away my luggage and get everything i owned cleaned and treated. Do not stay here, even if you already booked.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I am not even going to try and check in”
Reviews.Author: cablemigrant
Reviews.Content: I just called this hotel to ask for a late check in since my flight was getting in late. The manager on duty said not with out 48 hour notice, I booked the hotel yesterday.She then informed me that if I am not there by 6pm she will cancel my reservation and still bill me the 70 dollars for the room that she said she will sell to someone else tonight. Please fill this page with Appropriate reviews. I am Livid...

Reviews.Title: “Cabrini Green off the movie Candyman.. The worst stay ever I slept in my clothes on my coat and left without taking a shower. I ”
Reviews.Author: tcolon517
Reviews.Content: Nasty dirty and bums everywhere. The hotel matress is on wood not even a box spring. Thechairs in the room are beyond dirty, they use kys to open the doors. The smell is horrible

Reviews.Title: “It serves its purpose”
Reviews.Author: elizabeth e
Reviews.Content: if you want a simple yet clean room in a great location stay here the staff are super friendly and they helped me out big time I could pay day by day at the start of my stay cos my pay check never went though they didn't make me feel like a burden they were too cool understanding trusting about it there are also two really cool barber shops close by nyc style and a fresh hiphop clothing store and corner store and 3 min from college north people mover station what more could u want I was very happy and i stay 7 nites and got 2 free yeeeeha

Reviews.Title: “Real life SAW... I made it out alive!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelLady
Reviews.Content: Priceline.com really let me down with this hotel or should I say rent by the hour house filled with real like â€œSAWâ€� horror. We were greeted by crack heads and homeless people in the lobby and people up to no good outside on the streets. I know you are probably saying why didnâ€™t you just leave!?! Well, it was late after the football game and we had been traveling all day and just needed to get a few hours rest before getting back on the road so we decided to stay. Plus, we had already pre-paid through Priceline.com (which is a website I use for all my travel until now). I have a reservation to stay here again in March for Ultra that I also booked through Priceline.com which I will be cancelling now after this experience. If, you plan on staying at this hotel make sure to bring â€œprotectionâ€� or 5 bodyguards. There was what looked like to be blood on the walls and in the bathroom next to the toilet like a vein had squirted out blood from a heroin addicts arm. The shower was a 2 foot by 2 foot hole in the floor in front of the toilet that made you feel more disgusting after a shower. The bathroom had 100â€™s of ants that were traveling from the shower around the toilet, up the walls, in and out of the AC unit. After a few hours of not sleeping because the bed was only big enough to sleep a small dog. We had enough and decided it was time to get on the road earlier than we had planned because the hotel was so bad. But before we could go we had to fight off huge ants as they had taken over my purse in the middle of the night. We dumped my purse out on the bed and ants flew out of every inch of my purse. I know you are probably thinking â€œantsâ€� that would be the least of my worries after everything else you have been saying but really these were crazy huge ants with wings! After killing as many as we could on the floor we grabbed my purse to leave but then realized that the little ants from the toilet were coming and attacking the huge ant carcasses on the floor. They were sawing apart the bigger ants and carrying them away in what looked a factory line. That was probably the sickest thing ever and it made you feel like they are all over you, crawling in your ears and in your hair! As we were checking out I had mentioned to the lady at the front desk what we thought and she was not surprised at all. That confirmed with me right then that this was normal for her and that we would not be coming back. I hope that Priceline.com takes this off of their list and allows me to get my $300 refund for Ultraâ€¦ they can keep my $60 for my horrible night but I canâ€™t do that again in March. As we were leaving we had to cross through yellow crime scene tape blocking off the Night Club which is down the street from the hotel. There must have been a murder or something while we were trying to sleep because it looked bad. Enjoy the pictures of the flying ants!

Reviews.Title: “Even for UMF I would never stay here.”
Reviews.Author: valesyde
Reviews.Content: Spend an extra $20-30 a night and sleep somewhere else. At check in I had to kill a giant roach that was crawling by my shoe while standing at the front desk. The front desk lady did not look surprised and did not apologize. The room smelled like it had been entirely underwater at some time. Mold and mildew everywhere. I was honestly afraid if I slept there I would be eaten alive by giant roaches while I slept. I ended up not staying the night there, I just couldn't deal with the smell. It started to give me headaches. The pictures they have online make it look like its cheap but still clean. That is all a lie. This place should be shut down for health code violations. Avoid at all costs. No amount of money saved is worth the risk of staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Worst and most horrible stay”
Reviews.Author: Saleh2011
Reviews.Content: yes, the hotel is cheap but it is a dumpster, seriously. My wife and I wished we had slept in our car instead of staying in this trash. Not only that, but also the surrounding area is so dangerous and we were advised not to walk alone after 8PM. All night long there was a crowd of people fighting outside and we could not sleep. Therefore, at about 5:30AM we decided to check out and put an end to our horror night. When checking out, we were appalled to see the night-shift receptionist along with the two night guards all dancing to blaring rap beats. Definitely, one of the guards was drunk: I asked him about some directions and I could tell he was wasted. This trash hole deserves less than a zero rating.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for ULTRA”
Reviews.Author: Raveharder
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing, in every aspect. From the moment we walked in we were warmly welcomed by Doris, who was very accomadating to our last minute changes. She helped us navigate miami and waz very kind. This hotel is located next to a deadmau5 barber shop that has music all day and night outside. And the best cuban bodega in the city is right next store...simply delicious. We will stay here every time we come to miami.

Reviews.Title: “Never Ever Stay Here! Do not waste your time.”
Reviews.Author: davidttr
Reviews.Content: To start this review I will say that the prices for this hotel are very cheap, but of course you get what you pay for. Upon checking in you will be greeted by a very rude receptionist, and im not basing that on one individual im basing that on the entire staff of the hotel. Very unpleasent employees. Now onto to the room. If being roommates with mice and mold doesnt bother you than the room should be just fine. They are small, dirty and smell. If you look at the ceiling and walls you will quickly discover mold and water damage and leakage coming through. Gross is the only word to describe the rooms. The beds are old and just as filthy and you can bet your bottom dollar you will be spending the night with bed bugs. Not to mention being extremely uncomfortable. The bathrooms are just as out dated and neglected. I have no good things to say about the rooms in this hotel. Being in Miami the hotel has an alright location just minutes away from south beach and etc. HOWEVER! beware that it is not in the greatest area of Miami. All in all I do not recommend this hotel to anyone. Its old, dirty and neglected. The building is mold infested and really out dated. You will not enjoy any part of this hotel or your time in Miami if you are staying at the Miami Sun Hotel. I would also like to mention this is my first review I have ever written about a hotel, it ruined my vacation so much that I do not want anyone else wasting their time or money here. This hotel disgusted me so much that I want to inform anyone thinking of booking here. Its not a good deal its a rip off!

Reviews.Title: “Never stay in this hotel! It is really bad!!!”
Reviews.Author: DeKleintjes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not only bad, but also very dangerous. Gangs on the street, weird people in the hotel and the most horrible rooms i've ever seen. Don't let the location of this hotel or some positive reviews on this site change your mind. You really don't want to sleep or even be there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: rjc260
Reviews.Content: During a recent convention weekend, Miami prices were driven up astronomically. My South Beach hotel tripled from a previous rate and mediocre properties were charging well in excess of $100. Given some of the reviews, I was hesitant to try the Miami Sun but couldn't resist the $60 rate. I found the accommodations to be acceptable and even stayed two nights. Don't expect much, but the bed was fine, the a/c worked well and it was fairly quiet. Wi-fi worked perfectly in my third floor room. The front desk staff was exceptionally friendly and went out of their way to give advice on attractions and transportation. When you arrive it does have the slight appearance of a transient hotel but once settled in, that impression went away. It is a darker, quieter area of downtown, but is easily accessible to restaurants, shops and on close to major public transit routes. The only huge complaint I have is that the shower was either scalding hot or cold, making for a challenging shower. If you are on a budget and other hotels are significantly pricier, I would recommend the Miami Sun for a very basic choice.

Reviews.Title: “Scariest night of my life!!!”
Reviews.Author: worktoexplore
Reviews.Content: Before going on a cruise, thought we would stay at a cheap hotel close to the port. Worst decision. In retrospect...would def splurge on a more expensive hotel. The first sign of danger was when our cab driver asked us why we were staying there because he thought it was dirty. He was def right! After we got off of the rickety elevator to our room we saw the disaster. It looked like there was blood on the ceiling and a bullet hole through the window. We didn't sleep under the sheets for fear of what we might catch and even thought of sleeping on the towels we brought. I was awoken at 1:30am to 2 men pounding on our door wearing all black. I obviously didn't answer and they eventually left. I laid in bed the rest of the night scared for my life. I have traveled to many foreign countries where we may not have stayed in the nicest places, but this is the first place I have def been scared for my life. Would never stay at again and would def never recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hanging with the homeless”
Reviews.Author: Sternsl
Reviews.Content: The hotel makes a regular habit of letting what appear to be homeless men sleep in the chairs in the lobby. The clientele in the hotel was very similar, however, and people who were not guests seemed to come and go fairly regularly. (I know because I was sitting in the lobby with my laptop. It is the only place where you can connect to the internet). The rooms were very basic with window a/c. Although the mattress was decent, the pillows were almost flat. There weren't proper curtains over the windows so the room stayed lit. There were about five channels on the tv. The furniture looked like it had seen better days. The worst part was the bad bug bites that I got, which are currently swollen and very itchy. The only good thing about the hotel is the location, which is near to the free peoplemover. There is no parking, and I had to use a nearby garage, which charged $16 a night.

Reviews.Title: “There is no sun at this hotel! Just a large sewer!!!!! Horrible”
Reviews.Author: holmes59
Reviews.Content: I have never seen anything as awful as this place it was dirty,smelly and a sore site to see not fit for a dead dog. We traveled to Miami from Charleston SC arriving at about 9pm tired and ready to check in to our room which we booked online. There were holes in the wall spiders in the shower the bedding was dirty it did not take us a second to realize we were not staying there unlike must hotels this one had already debited our account and they refused to give funds back but told us that we had to go through the online agency never the less that couldn't keep us there I can not believe this place has not been condemned. Maybe we should all get together and do the state a favor and demolish this place for free.

Reviews.Title: “In the name of all that is holy stay away from this joint!”
Reviews.Author: Soulend
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here under any circumstance. If you are this hard up for cheap lodging you should drive to a better area and just sleep in your car. No kidding. I am absolutely AMAZED that this place is still in business and not shut down by the health or police department. When you enter your room(if you make it that far) you WILL stop dead in your tracks and be completely aghast. It's like something out of a horror film - so incredibly filthy, stinking, and run down that you will quite literally marvel at it's decrepitude. I've stayed in some nasty hotels all over the world and I cannot believe that this place is even in the United States. This place should be demolished so thoroughly that the ground beneath it could be plowed, and the front desk staff (such as it is) should be publicly flogged for their complete rudeness and apathy. If you set out to INTENTIONALLY make the filthiest, nastiest crackhouse possible you could not make a worse place. It is nothing short of surreal, particularly when darkness falls. Hotel and local attractions include hordes of homeless people just sort of hanging out around the entrance, drunken people openly urinating not only in the streets but right in the stairwells of the hotel, a deep pungent smell of vomit in the carpets so old that the regurgitants that made it are probably all dead by now, and a rude and disinterested staff that would put a flophouse in a third-world country to shame. Shopping/services would include a wide variety of prostitutes readily available in both the local area and hotel proper, illegal drugs of every description being sold right in the hotel lobby and right out front, and stolen merchandise is also easily obtained from many of the unsavory creatures wandering around. If you cancel you will not get your money back, and if you book through Priceline here is what will happen: Priceline will tell you that the refund authorization has to come from the hotel. The hotel will very rudely tell you that it has to come from Priceline. So kiss your money goodbye. Please take my advice and do not even begin to consider staying at this apocalyptically awful place. It may have been a decent hotel 60 or 70 years ago but now unfortunately it is a filthy tenement like something out of 'New Jack City', 'Escape From New York' or 'The Crow'.

Reviews.Title: “This building should be torn down”
Reviews.Author: HasStandards
Reviews.Content: The woman at the counter refused to look in the computer to find our reservation, so we waited about an hour for her coworker to come downstairs. He was absolutely obnoxious about him not having our reservation and rude about it on top of that. There are vagrants stationed in the front of the building, and completely unprofessional or courteous staff. The very safety of the neighborhood is questionable, and the building decrepit and in bad need of many repairs. I washed my hands as soon as I left the building. And I dont think I am ever going back to Miami if I can help it.

Reviews.Title: “Bottom of the barrel”
Reviews.Author: DustinMyselfOff
Reviews.Content: Not nearly cheap ENOUGH for how dirty and gross it is. If I had any other choice I would DEFINITELY stay somewhere else. I knew it would be bad, but I underestimated HOW bad. I would absolutely suggest that you stay away.

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets...”
Reviews.Author: oquendo1590
Reviews.Content: for a broke college student!... This place was amazing. The price was perfect. We paid for 5 nights and got 2 free!.. It did seem a little sketchy at first, but then we discovered that the location was great and the people weren't that bad. The hotel is secured at night. They close the lobby doors at 11pm and you have to show an id to get in... They offered room cleaning for an EXTRA CHARGE but we were more than welcome to bring down dirty linen to be exchanged for fresh ones and to use their broom! =D Susan and Tony (hotel staff) were kick a$$! They were both very down to earth & helpful. I did not see any roaches or other bugs, thank God! It's not a fancy schmancy hotel, but who needs one when you're here to enjoy Miami. I was only in my room at night to sleep... This is a great hotel if you're not high maintenance!

Reviews.Title: “Very basic indeed”
Reviews.Author: bigpad
Reviews.Content: The review of 09 February 2009 by "gvilleguy" is spot on. There are no frills. But I was able to book in advance via a secure payment. This place is as basic as it gets but the front-desk staff are ok and helpful enough, esp. the girl of Chinese origin. Room 210 is next to a generator or such like on the roof outside. It starts whirring at 6.30 a.m. and you'll do well to sleep through it. Try and stay in room 218 or above. The diner next door is a student-type place but is ok. Getting there: the no. 7 bus runs from the airport andc costs $2.00. It takes about 40 mins but is a hell of a saving over the $25.00 I paid for a taxi ride in. If going by bus, get off (or on) at Miami-Dade County College, Downtown campus. The hotel is 75 yards away. Finally, downtown Miami closes after tea-time. So you won't get an internet cafe for love nor money any closer than Miami Beach. Needles to say, the hotel has no internet.

Reviews.Title: “low budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: gvilleguy
Reviews.Content: This is a low budget hotel near downtown Miami (not near Miami Beach). I will try to attach some pictures of the room. I certainly cannot recommend this hotel, although for single guys or maybe groups of people who don't have much money, this place is better than sleeping in the gutter. I certainly would not recommend this for couples or single females unless you have a compelling need to be in this part of town and your other option is sleeping on the street. I paid $80 in Feb 2009 on short notice, but I have seen other posts with lower numbers (maybe it is seasonal?). The other option for cheap hotel in this area is the Roadway Inn, which has bigger rooms, but cost more and is noisier and crappier than the Miami Sun. Do NOT stay in the Barlington or Spanish River hotels. First the good stuff: 1) There were low levels of allergens, perhaps because the floors throughout the entire building tile instead of carpet. 2) The location is good. It is close to American Airlines Arena, Bayside Mall, and many of the government buildings and courthouse buildings. 3) There is a small diner next door, which is convenient. The guy at the counter was nice, although he did not know was decaffeinated coffee was. The diner is basically crappy but the prices are reasonable and it is open for breakfast. 4) The people at the desk were helpful with directions. 5) You can get to the hotel using Metrorail for $2 from any of these points: The Miami Amtrak station, the Miami Airport (via bus#42 to Amtrak then walk a few blocks), Ft Lauderdale airport (via Tri-rail, which is an additional $4 and connects to Metrorail). See my notes at the bottom for details. And now the not so good 1) There are no amenities: a) no alarm clock b) no hair dryer, iron, ironing board, coffee maker, microwave c) There were two bars of soap, but they were very tiny, even by hotel standards. 2) There were only a couple of the very cheap, wire hangars that were too weak to hold my wool coat (there was a cold spell in the place where I started my trip) 3) There were only 2 towels and they were small, very thin, and one had dark grey spots. There are no hand towels, wash cloths, or floor mat for the bathroom 4) There was barely any hot water on Friday morning at around 7:00 am, although I had decent hot water on Sunday. 5) There was a lot of noise outside the hotel on Friday night--mostly loud cars, car alarms, and some people talking. The single-pain windows and perhaps openings around the air conditioner offered very poor sound insulation. Surprisingly, Saturday night was pretty quiet except for some distant white noise from cars. 6) There is no weather stripping or pad around the door frame, so when guests leave at 4:00 am to catch a plane, they will probably slam the door, which echoes in the tile hallway and enters the 3/4" crack under the room door. 7) There was a new sink in my room, but no counter. 8) There was no shampoo, lotion, conditioner, coffee, tea or other such things 9) The procedures for booking the room were very odd. I had to go to themiamisunhotel.com, print a reservation form, and fax it to them with a Xerox of my driver's license and credit card (I noticed other reviews that said the same thing). 10) My room was very small, and there was "old grime" in some areas of the bathroom and many layers of sloppy paint that create nooks for dust and germs. There wasn't much "fresh grime." 11) There were no "do not disturb" signs 12) The light bulb in the lamp didn't work 13) There was a mix of guests, and only a couple appeared to be people that I didn't want in the next room. There was one normal-looking family that spoke Spanish (they were OK), one guy that I thought was homeless (I'm not sure if he was a guest or just talking to somebody in the lobby), a career party girl with a big mouth, and a baggy-panted punk. 14) The blanket was really thin and cheap, but I guess there isn't much of a need for warm blankets. I did not try the heat or AC, but there was a window air conditioner (maybe the heater was in the AC unit??). 15) The curtain did not block the light, so when the sun rises, your room will be bright (and this might make it difficult to sleep late) 16) The key is a single, metal key that any moron could duplicate. There is also a 5$ key deposit that is returned at checkout. == METRORAIL directions: From Amtrak station (which is near Miami Airport): A) If you are INSIDE the Amtrak station in Miami, exit through the main double doors and turn right. B) Walk down the block past the electric transformers that occupy almost a full city block. This is mostly an industrial area, but there are a couple houses on theleft. C) Go about 3 blocks until you see the overhead train track (it is about 2 stories above ground on stilts), D) Turn right, go one block to the train station, but PAY ATTENTION!. E) If you are going to the hotel, you want to get on the **Metrorail** buy going up TWO FLIGHTS of escalators (or elevator) and take it SOUTHBOUND. Be sure to listen to all announcements to be sure that you are going south to get to the hotel. There is a different train system that connects at the same spot, so stay awake. F) Exit the Metrorail at Government Center (101 NW 1st Street) and walk toward the big courthouse buildings to get to the hotel). Bring a map printed from maps.yahoo.com. FROM MIAMI INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT: 1) You have two options for getting from the airport to the Metrorail. A) Take bus #42 which goes to the front door of the Amtrak station. B) take a cab. 2) Follow the directions above to get from Amtrak to the hotel FROM FT. LAUDERDALE AIRPORT. A) take the Tri-rail from the airport (I don't know exactly where it is, ask around--my friend took it from Ft. Lauderdale). It costs around $4. B) You will arrive at the transfer point to Metrorail. This is also a few blocks from the Amtrak station (see above) and relatively close to Miami Airport. C) Exit the Tri-Rail and go up two flights of escalators and get on the MetroRail GOING SOUTH. Listen to all announcements. D) Exit the Metrorail at Government Center (101 NW 1st Street) and walk toward the big courthouse buildings to get to the hotel). Bring a map printed from maps.yahoo.com.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough”
Reviews.Author: Easygoingguy99
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Miami Sun occassionally usually for a a couple of weeks at a time and I'm very satisfied. Nobody bothers me, the staff are friendly, and the rooms are comfortable. The other posters must have been hard to please because I have never seen or heard any of the things they describe. The hotel is downtown and with it does bring a few unpleasant people--but that can be said for any major city. Pay triple the price just a couple of blocks away if you want more than a basic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It could be worse, but not by much.”
Reviews.Author: CanadianCorrie
Reviews.Content: We picked this place for its location and price, which are great if you want to be in downtown Miami. We are low budget travelers with low expectations. However, the Miami Sun is a place like no other. If you are looking for an experience you will find it here. We had some hesitations about this motel. It looked really run down from the outside. However the staff at the front desk were genuinely friendly and helpful so we figured it couldn't be that bad. We paid about US$63. The elevator is a bit frightening, but we didn't have any serious problems. The room is basic. Smelled kind of funny, paper thin towels, but a room. As said in another review, 'better than sleeping on a park bench." TV and a/c worked fine. There is a secure pay parking lot across the street which was nice. We think we were on a floor all to ourselves because we didn't hear any noise from other rooms all night (we may have been put there for reasons explained below). The other hotel guests appeared all normal during the day, however, at night the freaks not only came out, but came into the Miami Sun! The hotel is close to a really shady area of town so we expected to have see some weirdos around the area. We did not expect to see people high out of their minds, peeing in the stairwell, and drug deals going on in the hotel! We like to think that we are open minded folks and we don't really care what others do, but there were some serious freaks staying at the Miami Sun that night.. We decided to lock everything important in the car and slept in our sleeping bags on the bed. (Yes we were that grossed out). I guess if you plan to be in by 7 pm and not leave your room until morning, the Miami Sun would be ok. (Bring your sleeping bags!) Otherwise beware and be careful. This end or Miami really changes at night. The Miami Sun could really improve by just being a bit more selective about their customers. Crappy rooms are fine, but I don't like being scared when walking through the lobby. On the otherhand it gave me a story to tell.

Reviews.Title: “If you're poor or cheap it's not that bad”
Reviews.Author: sv_makai
Reviews.Content: We couldn't figure out why the building hadn't been condemned. The property is in unbelievable disrepair but the staff was super friendly and helpful especially Susan and Dolores. Our first room was very noisey because of a connecting door with the adjacent room. The towels were as thin as sheets, the pillows as thin as towels and the sheets like gauze with some tears and cigarrette burn holes. The location was great and we didn't have any altercations though we were back in the hotel by 8pm most nights. If you need a cheap place to stay and don't feel like sleeping on a bench across the street at the university this place will do in a pinch.

Reviews.Title: “economical and rt in downtown”
Reviews.Author: dairykid
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 days in the hotel, well the room i stayed wasnt that bad.. i would recommend for loner's and budget minded travellers who just use the room to sleep and shower, i was out most of the time so it was ok with me, i wouldn't recommend this for family.. well if ur the party kindd and wanna save some bucks in rooms its perfect.. well i had tv, phone, a/c and hot water all working.. well the lift smells old.. but the rooms dont smell, front desk the guy(asian) needs some training he was sitting with his foot up on the desk.. well the ladies in the front desk were real nice and special credit to the (african american) she was such a darling very helpful , cheerful one.. in total i would say its worth the money u pay for.. and blocks away from port miami..

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: maddycoo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I come down to Miami every winter to escape the cold and we love The Miami Sun. The staff are so friendly, they help with arranging tours, transportation, and even let me in on some secret shopping spots to get good deals. We love to spend time in the lobby chatting with the European and Carribean travellers who also stay there regularly. The place is older but has personality. We reccommend it to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel in Downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: Elixabeth
Reviews.Content: Miami Sun Hotel is a great budget hotel. I needed to be Downtown for business and didn't want to spend a whole lot of money. It was a clean but simple room. There is a resturant next door, the staff was friendly and helpful. For the price I was very happy. The locations is great. Walking distance to the Courthouse, Bayside, Hard Rock Cafe, Shopping etc... Nothing Fancy but a great buy for my dollar. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The worst of the worst.”
Reviews.Author: drdisaster
Reviews.Content: Booked this on hotwire.com as a two star. the boat show was in Miami and nothing... I mean nothing.. was left. I've had great love for Hotwire.com and figured a two star would be ok for a night. Problems: 1)Cockroaches in lobby and in room 2)Doors with hack marks around locks like they'd been picked or kicked (several rooms). 3)Several questionable "deals" doing on outside. 4)Paper thin walls with loud noise all night. 5)Burn marks in sheets 6)Dirty towels I've stayed in the best and worst all over the world, but for the money and the place... this was the worst. Do not ever stay here... To hotwire.com's credit, I complained with photos, and hotwire credited my stay and downgraded this dump to one-star. Still not worth it as a one star unless you study cockroaches.
